intro: Eriocaulon chishingsanensis, commonly known as the Chishingsan sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, showcasing its adaptation to moist environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
